text: The Pacific West Conference Men's Basketball Tournament is the annual conference basketball championship tournament for the Pacific West Conference (PacWest). The tournament has been held annually since 2013. It is a single- elimination tournament and seeding is based on regular season records. The winner, declared conference champion, receives the conference's automatic bid to the NCAA Men's Division II Basketball Championship. ==Results== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Year !Champions !Score !Runner-Up !Venue |- align=center | 2013 | Dixie State | 92–80 | Chaminade | Azusa, CA |- align=center | 2014 | Chaminade | 99–83 | Dominican | San Diego, CA |- align=center | 2015 | BYU–Hawaii | 84–79 | California Baptist | Irvine, CA |- align=center | 2016 | California Baptist | 101–64 | Azusa Pacific | Irvine, CA |- align=center | 2017 | Hawaii Pacific | 83–73 | Point Loma Nazarene | Irvine, CA |- align=center | 2018 | Dixie State | 66–64 | California Baptist | Riverside, CA |- align=center | 2019 | Point Loma Nazarene | 67-58 | Concordia–Irvine | San Rafael, CA |- align=center | 2020 | Point Loma Nazarene | 98–95 (OT) | Biola | Azusa, CA |} ==Championship records== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;" |- !
